meanings.definition: In a socially awkward or tactless manner.
meanings.sent1: She greeted the guests gauchely, stumbling over her words.
meanings.sent2: He danced gauchely at the party, stepping on toes.
meanings.sent3: Despite her best intentions, she always ends up behaving gauchely in social situations.
meanings.sent4: His attempt at humor landed gauchely, causing an uncomfortable silence.
meanings.sent5: The puppy tried to play fetch gauchely, tripping over its own tail.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of grace or elegance.
meanings.sent1: Her gauchely movements drew attention for all the wrong reasons.
meanings.sent2: The gauchely decorated room clashed with the elegant theme of the party.
meanings.sent3: The clown's gauchely oversized shoes made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: The old mansion stood gauchely against the modern skyline.
meanings.sent5: The gauchely painted artwork failed to impress the critics.

meanings.sent1: She juggled gauchely, dropping the balls one by one.
meanings.sent2: The child walked gauchely in his oversized shoes.
meanings.sent3: The waiter balanced the tray gauchely, almost spilling the drinks.
meanings.sent4: The tree swayed gauchely in the strong wind.
meanings.sent5: The robot moved gauchely, bumping into walls and furniture.
